message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the design and analysis of regenerating codes for distributed storage systems, which involves concepts from information theory (cs.IT), distributed systems (cs.DS), network protocols and algorithms (cs.NI), signal processing (cs.SI), and coding theory (cs.CC). The paper explicitly mentions interference alignment (IA) as a key theme, which is a signal processing technique used in wireless communication systems to mitigate interference. Therefore, cs.SI and cs.NI are likely categories. The paper also discusses the construction of codes that achieve the cut-set bound, which is a fundamental result in information theory, and the use of maximum distance separable (MDS) codes, which are a well-studied class of codes in coding theory. Hence, cs.IT and cs.CC are also likely categories. Finally, the paper deals with the practical aspects of implementing regenerating codes in distributed storage systems, such as minimizing repair bandwidth and ensuring exact repair, which are relevant to the design of distributed systems (cs.DS).
